Yes, here are some suggestions for incorporating physical interactions with pets into our daily routine during long-term isolation:

1. Take your pet for a walk: Taking your pet on a walk can provide enrichment, exercise, and fresh air, and it provides an opportunity for bonding.

2. Play with your pet: Playtime with pets can be beneficial for their physical and emotional well-being while also providing an opportunity for physical interaction.

3. Groom your pet: Grooming pets can be enjoyable for both the pet and the owner, and it provides an opportunity for physical touch that can promote bonding.

4. Cuddle with your pet: Cuddling with pets promotes physical touch and can lead to the release of feel-good hormones that promote relaxation.

5. Teach your pet new tricks: Training pets can be a fun and engaging way to spend time together, promote cognition and learning, and promote bonding.

6. Provide your pet with a massage: Massages are relaxing for pets and can provide an opportunity for physical touch that can promote bonding.

These are just a few examples of ways to incorporate physical interaction with pets into our daily routine. Remember to observe health and safety guidelines regarding interacting with pets during the COVID-19 pandemic.
